snippet: After Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s victory, Israelis began to confront the social and political fissures that crisscross the country.
abstract: Israeli election highlights political divisions in nation as rural residents and Jews of Middle Eastern and North African backgrounds largely vote for right-wing and strictly Orthodox parties, including Likud; in contrast, urban and suburban voters, kubbutz residents and Jews of European descent vote for center-left and leftist parties.
lead_paragraph: After Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s victory, Israelis began to confront the social and political fissures that crisscross the country.

headline.main: Abiding Rifts Within Israel Threaten to Widen With Netanyahu Win
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu’s Victory Lays Bare Ethnic Divide Between Left and Right
